sen.j: 蘭溪道隆（らんけい どうりゅう、建保元年（1213年） - 弘安元年7月24日 (旧暦)（1278年8月13日））は、鎌倉時代中期の南宋から渡来した禅僧・大覚派の祖。
sen.e: Doryu RANKEI (1213 - August 13, 1278) was a Zen priest and the founder of the Daikaku-ha group who came to Japan from China in Southern Sung Dynasty in the middle era of the Kamakura period.

Doryu RANKEI (1213 - August 13, 1278) was a Zen priest and the founder of the Daikaku-ha group who came to Japan from China at the time of the Southern Sung Dynasty in the middle of the Kamakura Period.

Rankei Doryu (1213 - August 13, 1278) was a Zen priest and the founder of the Daikaku-ha school who came to Japan from China at the time of the Southern Sung Dynasty in the middle of the Kamakura Period.

sen.e: He became a priest at the aged of 13, learnt under Bushun Shiban and Hokukan Kyokan, and then succeeded the principle of Wu-ming Hui-hsing (Mumyo Esho) who succeeded the principle of Songyuan (Shogen-Sugaku).

sen.j: 1246年(寛元4年)33歳で、入宋した泉涌寺僧、月翁智鏡との縁により、弟子とともに来日。
sen.e: In 1246 when he was 33 years old, he met Chikyo GATTO, a priest at Sennyu-ji Temple who came to Sung, and through relationships with GATTO, he came to Japan together with his disciples.

sen.j: 筑前円覚寺・京都泉涌寺の来迎院・鎌倉寿福寺などに寓居。
sen.e: He stayed temporarily at Enkaku-ji Temple in Tsukushi, at Raigo-in of Sennyu-ji Temple in Kyoto and at Jufuku-ji Temple in Kamakura.

sen.j: 宋風の本格的な臨済宗を広める。

sen.e: For a period of time, he was suspected of being a spy from Yuan (Yuan Dynasty).

sen.e: Therefore, he fled to Izu, and made the Buddhist principle of Shuzen-ji Temple converted to that of his.
